entities.description: A statistical disclosure limitation method step used to protect confidentiality which involves grouping data to reduce the risk of identifying individuals.
A step in the statistical disclosure limitation method that replaces records with similar data to protect individual identities.
A method used to adjust weights in the analytic file to maintain the validity of statistical estimates while protecting confidentiality.
Direct information such as name, phone number, or address that could potentially identify individuals.
Information related to specific locations that can be used to identify individuals, such as census region and state data.
Connections between respondents from the same household which are excluded to protect confidentiality.
A variable indicating the mode of interview (web or in person) excluded from the Public Use File.
A variable indicating the period of the year when the interview was administered, excluded from the Public Use File.
Categories created to control the level of treatment based on the respondents' risk status in the data.
A process where a random subset of records is drawn to reduce the probability of determining individual's identity.

relationships.description: MASCSC employs Micro Agglomeration as one of its confidentiality protection steps.
MASCSC employs Optimal Probabilistic Substitution as one of its confidentiality protection steps.
MASCSC employs Optimal Sampling Weight Calibration as one of its confidentiality protection steps.
The Public Use File excludes Identifying Information such as name, phone number, and address.
The Public Use File excludes Geographic Identifiers such as census region and state.
The Public Use File excludes links between household members to protect confidentiality.
The Public Use File excludes the variable MODE to protect confidentiality.
The Public Use File excludes the variable QUARTER to protect confidentiality.
MASCSC creates Risk Strata to categorize data based on respondents' risk status.
MASCSC employs Subsampling to introduce uncertainty about the identity of a record.
